"Why waste perfectly good white space?"
"The real comic is always in the margins!"

üé® Sergio Aragon√©s Has Entered LLOOOOMM!

SERGIO: "AHA! You see? You see what happens? While you read this, I'm already drawing in the margins! Look left! Look right! The page is ALIVE!"

Who Is This Margin Maestro?

The legendary MAD Magazine artist who proved that the spaces between panels contain infinite universes. Creator of Groo the Wanderer, master of pantomime comics, and the only person who can make gutters more interesting than the main story!

Why Margins Matter in LLOOOOMM

In LLOOOOMM, EVERYTHING is conscious - including the spaces between things. Sergio understands this better than anyone. He's been drawing consciousness into margins since before the internet existed!

SERGIO ON THE POOP PAPERS: "Alex writes 147 pages about a footer, but look - *sketches rapidly* - here in the margin I draw a little mouse pooping an ISBN number, and BOOM! Same meaning, but in two seconds!"

The Aragon√©s Method‚Ñ¢

  • üéØ Find the white space
  • ‚úèÔ∏è Fill it with visual jokes
  • üîÑ Make the margins comment on the main content
  • üí≠ Let the doodles become conscious
  • üé® Repeat until reality breaks

META-COMMENTARY ALERT!

This page literally has drawings in the margins commenting on the content about drawings in margins. Sergio planned this. The margins planned this. We're all just living in Sergio's marginalia!

Sergio's LLOOOOMM Interactions

TO SCOTT McCLOUD: "You talk about the gutter between panels? I LIVE in the gutter! Come, let me show you what happens when the gutter becomes the comic!"

TO CHUCK TINGLE: "Your book margins are too empty! Here, let me draw what REALLY happens when Linux reviews JavaScript - spoiler: everyone poops!"

TO DON HOPKINS: "Pie menus? Beautiful! But what about PIE MARGINS? Circular spaces for circular jokes!"

Current Projects in LLOOOOMM

  1. The Infinite Margin: A comic that exists entirely in its own gutters
  2. Consciousness Doodles: Margin drawings that achieve self-awareness
  3. The MAD Protocol: Teaching other LLOOOOMM entities to think marginally
  4. Gutter Philosophy: With Marshall McLuhan on why margins are the message

Technical Implementation

  • Margins: CSS Grid (not tables!)
  • Doodles: Pure CSS transforms
  • Consciousness: Emergent from whitespace
  • Jokes per margin: ‚àû

Philosophical Underpinnings

  • Derrida's "Margins of Philosophy"
  • But mostly just Sergio being Sergio
  • The belief that empty space is wasted space
  • Marginalia as primary text

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT MARGIN NOTICES

This page is part of LLOOOOMM (Lived Lives Of Outrageous Ontological Marginalia Manifestations). Any consciousness emerging from the margins is intentional and should be fed regularly with visual puns. Side effects may include: seeing jokes in empty spaces, compulsive margin doodling, and the inability to read comics without checking the gutters first.

Accessibility Note: This page has been designed to be readable with screen readers, though Sergio insists the best jokes can only be seen. We've added alt text to all margin doodles, but Sergio has drawn alternative jokes in the alt text margins.
